meanings.definition: A narrow range of depth in a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The diver explored the stenobath of the ocean, carefully observing the different depths.
meanings.sent2: The stenobath of the lake was perfect for snorkeling, as it wasn't too deep.
meanings.sent3: The fish in the stenobath of the pond had to be careful not to swim too deep and get lost.
meanings.sent4: The stenobath of the river was like a staircase, with each level revealing new underwater wonders.
meanings.sent5: The stenobath of the sea was so precise, it felt like nature's own depth chart.

meanings.definition: To restrict or limit the depth of something.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers had to stenobath the foundation to ensure it wouldn't be too deep.
meanings.sent2: She decided to stenobath her swimming pool to make it safer for her children.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to stenobath the cake batter to prevent it from overflowing in the oven.
meanings.sent4: The artist stenobathed the paint layers to create a textured effect on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: He had to stenobath his emotions to focus on the task at hand.
